abstract: Daquan Breland, man accused of opening fire on rival Anthony Hennis in Brooklyn in 2013 and killing his 1-year-old son Antiq in stroller, is convicted of second-degree murder; Daquan Wright, who gave Breland pistol, is convicted of second-degree criminal possession of weapon.
lead_paragraph: Daquan Breland was convicted of second-degree murder and Daquan Wright was convicted of second-degree criminal possession of a weapon in the death of Antiq Hennis.

headline.main: 2 Convicted in 2013 Fatal Shooting of Brooklyn Boy in a Stroller
headline.print_headline: Man Convicted of Murder of a Boy, 1, in a Stroller

snippet: Daquan Breland was convicted of second-degree murder and Daquan Wright was convicted of second-degree criminal possession of a weapon in the death of Antiq Hennis.
